Technique: DOVETAIL (JOINT); WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Greek papyrus
Description: This fragment of papyrus (P. Fay. 249), which dates from the end of the 1st century or the beginning of the 2nd century of our time, is a letter of a veteran of the Roman army, named Lucius Bellienus Gemellus, to his slave Epagathus. This latter was steward of several  agricultural farms belonging to his master in the north-west of the Faiyum. The letter is part of an abundant correspondance by Gemellus found at Euhemeria.
